bibl.title: Ὑπομνήματα ἐπιγεννήσεως: the Greco-Egyptian Birth Returns in Roman Egypt and the Case of P. Petaus 1-2. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Tackles the question of whether the nature of the birth returns filed by Greco-Egyptian people could be interpreted as such or rather as applications to register a child in privileged status. - [Introduction]. - Birth returns or applications to register a child for privileged status? - The relationship between the birth returns and the fourteen-year cycle. - The hypothetical birth returns of Alexandria and those of the Greek cities. - The Antinoopolis returns. - The apo metropoleos and priests from Arsinoites and the apo gymnasiou from Oxyrhynchus. - The epicrisis and the birth returns: an unclear relationship. - P. Petaus 1-2. - P. Petaus 2, ll. 8-12 (= 1, ll. 11-17) [pp. 126-127: text and interpretation of O. Brüssel-Berlin 14].
